BT2025002:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 3 treating bilateral upper lobes.
Patient: [REDACTED], 50-year-old male with severe persistent asthma after completion of lower lobe thermoplasty sessions.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation.
Procedure details: Under general anesthesia, flexible bronchoscopy was performed via endotracheal tube. The bronchial thermoplasty catheter was sequentially deployed in the right and left upper lobe segmental bronchi. Fifty-eight activations were delivered with good catheter contact and appropriate cycle times. Airways were re-inspected and remained hemostatic and patent.
Complications: No immediate bronchospasm or significant hypoxemia.
Disposition: Admitted overnight to the step-down unit for observation and systemic steroid taper.
